attributes.action: create a 'supercarb' food group for potatoes to reflect the fact that they are both an energy-rich starchy carbohydrate AND a vegetable which is packed-full of essential vitamins and minerals.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Following new research by Potato Council which found consumers are confused about the health benefits of potatoes, potato growers are calling for potatoes to be re-classified as a ‘supercarb’ – a new food group that highlights just how much goodness potatoes contain.
 
The potato is unique - officially classified as a starchy carbohydrate, it is the only food in this category which is also a vegetable.
 
Potatoes are packed full of energy whilst containing all the goodness of vegetables including vitamins B1, B6 and unlike rice and pasta, vitamin C. Potatoes are also naturally fat free.
 
Potato growers believe a new ‘supercarb’ food group will help consumers make informed decisions about including in their diet.
